headline: Netanyahu tells Congressmen that the Iran Deal is bad for the US
author: JERUSALEM POST STAFF
sentences: Present at the talk were Senator Mike Lee (R-UT) and Congressmen Jim Jordan (R-OH), Louis Gohmert (R-TX), Andy Harris (Maryland), Andy Barr (R-KY), Doug Lamborn (R-CO), Bill Johnson (R-OH), Barry Moore (R-AL) and Russ Fulcher (R-ID).
Former prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu told US Congress that the Iran Deal is a big mistake and will harm Israel as well as the US in a special Congressional virtual mission on Thursday.
ADDRESSING THE UN General Assembly in 2012, then-prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu draws a red line on an illustration depicting Iranâ€™s ability to create a nuclear weapon.
Netanyahu went on to state that those who are currently negotiating the terms of the deal are working toward containment, not prevention.
The talk was introduced by Binyamin Regional Governor Israel Ganz who spoke about the wave of terror currently plaguing Israel.
Former Benjamin Netanyahu spoke to Congress at a special virtual mission on Thursday.
"Obviously, if Iran has nuclear weapons, it's very bad news for basically everyone.
It's very bad news for Israel, clearly, but it's also very bad news for America."
"You do not contain an Islamist bomb, you prevent it," he concluded.
"We have to prevent Iran from getting nuclear weapons.
"We have to stand up to Iran," said Netanyahu.
